parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
Page number to retrieve.If you provide invalid value the default page number will applied

Example: 1

Default Value: 1

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Number of records per page.

Example: 20

Default Value: 20

Max Value: 100

If provided value is greater than max value, max value will be applied.

parameters.name: filter.platform.plt_constant
parameters.description:
Filter by platform.plt_constant query param.

Format: filter.platform.plt_constant={$not}:OPERATION:VALUE

Example: filter.platform.plt_constant=$not:$like:John Doe&filter.platform.plt_constant=like:John

Available Operations

  • $and
  • $or
  • $not
  • $eq
  • $gt
  • $gte
  • $in
  • $null
  • $lt
  • $lte
  • $btw
  • $ilike
  • $sw
  • $contains

parameters.name: filter.project.prj_id
parameters.description:
Filter by project.prj_id query param.

Format: filter.project.prj_id={$not}:OPERATION:VALUE

Example: filter.project.prj_id=$not:$like:John Doe&filter.project.prj_id=like:John

Available Operations

  • $and
  • $or
  • $not
  • $eq
  • $gt
  • $gte
  • $in
  • $null
  • $lt
  • $lte
  • $btw
  • $ilike
  • $sw
  • $contains

parameters.name: filter.ver_id
parameters.description:
Filter by ver_id query param.

Format: filter.ver_id={$not}:OPERATION:VALUE

Example: filter.ver_id=$not:$like:John Doe&filter.ver_id=like:John

Available Operations

  • $and
  • $or
  • $not
  • $eq
  • $gt
  • $gte
  • $in
  • $null
  • $lt
  • $lte
  • $btw
  • $ilike
  • $sw
  • $contains

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description:
Parameter to sort by.

To sort by multiple fields, just provide query param multiple types. The order in url defines an order of sorting

Format: fieldName:DIRECTION

Example: sortBy=id:DESC&sortBy=createdAt:ASC

Default Value: ver_id:DESC

Available Fields

  • ver_id
  • ver_name

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Search term to filter result values

Example: John

Default Value: No default value

parameters.name: searchBy
parameters.description:
List of fields to search by term to filter result values

Example: ver_name

Default Value: By default all fields mentioned below will be used to search by term

Available Fields

  • ver_name

info.title: Appupdate API
info.description:
This API uses the concept of "upset". If the `UUID` is not present in the request, it indicates a creation action. If the `UUID` is present, it indicates an update action.

## TOKEN

To generate a valid TOKEN to authorize these requests, you MUST first login to FIREBASE on frontend. Then, use the `/auth/login` endpoint to generate the token. Once you have the token, click the "Authorize" button below and paste the token value into the input field, then click "Authorize" again!.

Actually this API does not have API-KEY for the requests, but is planned to have in the future to the paid plans.

The only endpoint that requires an API-KEY is the `/check-version` endpoint. Which is the unique endpoint that your app will use.

slug.description: The unique slug of the billing plan

label.description: The label of the billing plan

title.description: The subscription status title of the user

message.description: The informative message about the billing status

color.description: The color corresponding to the billing status (for frontend display purposes)

should_show_warning.description: Flag indicating if a warning should be displayed on the frontend

billing.description: The detailed billing object associated with the user

plan.description: The billing plan associated with the user

active.description: Whether the product is currently available for purchase

attributes.description: Array of attributes for the product

created.description: Time at which the object was created (Unix timestamp)

default_price.description: ID of the default price for this product

features.description: Array of features for the product

images.description: Array of URLs for images of the product

livemode.description: Whether the object exists in live mode

package_dimensions.description: Dimensions of the product for shipping purposes

shippable.description: Whether this product is shipped (physical goods)

type.description: Type of the product (good or service)

unit_label.description: Label representing units of the product

updated.description: Time at which the object was last updated (Unix timestamp)

url.description: URL of a publicly-accessible webpage for the product

aggregate_usage.description: Specifies how to compute the usage aggregation for the price.

interval.description: The frequency with which a subscription is billed.

interval_count.description: The number of intervals between each subscription billing.

trial_period_days.description: The number of days in a trial period or `null` if the price is not on trial.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

active.description: Whether the price can be used for new purchases.

billing_scheme.description: Describes how to compute the price per period.

created.description: Time at which the object was created. Measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO currency code, in lowercase. Must be a supported currency.

currency_options.description: Prices defined in each available currency option.

custom_unit_amount.description: Configuration for the amount to be adjusted by the customer during Checkout Sessions and Payment Links.

livemode.description: Has the value true if the object exists in live mode or the value false if the object exists in test mode.

lookup_key.description: A lookup key used to retrieve prices dynamically from a static string.

metadata.description: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object.

nickname.description: A brief description of the price, hidden from customers.

product.description: The ID of the product this price is associated with.

recurring.description: The recurring components of a price such as interval and usage_type.

tax_behavior.description: Specifies whether the price is considered inclusive of taxes or exclusive of taxes.

tiers.description: Each element represents a pricing tier.

tiers_mode.description: Defines if the tiering price should be graduated or volume based.

transform_quantity.description: Apply a transformation to the reported usage or set quantity before computing the amount billed.

type.description: One of one_time or recurring depending on whether the price is for a one-time purchase or a recurring (subscription) purchase.

unit_amount.description: The unit amount in cents to be charged, represented as a whole integer if possible.

unit_amount_decimal.description: The unit amount in cents to be charged, represented as a decimal string with at most 12 decimal places.

stp_id.description: The unique identifier of a stripe_product.

stp_product_id.description: The ID of the product item in Stripe.

stp_product_price_id.description: The ID of the pricing/plan item in Stripe.

stp_plan_type.description: The chosen plan for the product.

created_at.description: The date the product was created.

deleted_at.description: The date the product was last updated.

billings.description: List of billings associated with the stripe product.

is_current_plan.description: Flag indicating if the plan is the current plan for the user

button_text.description: The text to display on the button

value.description: The value associated with the configuration

example.conf_description: Updates about your billing and payments.

configs.description: The configurations associated with the category

new_value.description: The new value for the configuration

year.description: Metadata for yearly subscription plans in Stripe

monthly.description: Metadata for monthly subscription plans in Stripe

version.description: The current version of the application.

platform.description: The platform on which the application is running. This can be any platform that the application supports.

language.description: The language that the application is currently using. This is optional and defaults to "en" if not provided.

api_key.description: The API key used to authenticate the request.
